reviews.text: Reasonable prices for rooms and food. Good pubs.
A whole day of sightseeing and I'll be back for the rest
Scenic station linking Glasgow and Edinburgh

Had the pleasure of using this station over the last two days and I would like to give a wee mention to the staff especially Harry who was a true gentleman last night after our train was cancelled. Harry supplied myself and sister in law with a bottle of much needed water and a kit kat a lovely gesture from a lovely man and the staff ensuring everyones safety on the platform were fantastic to.

The local signs say Linlithgow is one of Scotland's oldest railway stations. There is a photograph from 1845 on a sign at the station. 
The station is well serviced with a ticket office on the north side (trains going east). There is a pedestrian underpass to reach the south side for trains going west. On the south side there is a Bike & Go station for renting bicycles. There are vending machines for coffee, soft drinks and snacks. The station is located on the side of a hill and has a lovely view if you are tall enough to look over a wall.
